name: ListOrgCodeScanningAlerts
description:
Retrieve code scanning alerts for an organization's repositories.

This tool lists code scanning alerts for the default branch of all eligible repositories within a specified organization. It requires the user to be an owner or security manager of the organization, and access tokens with the necessary scopes (`repo`, `security_events`, or `public_repo` for public repositories).

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the organization. This field is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: filter_by_tool_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of a code scanning tool to filter results. Only alerts from this tool will be listed. Ensure not to use `tool_guid` if this is specified.

value_schema.description: The name of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_name` or `tool_guid`, but not both.

parameters.name: code_scanning_tool_guid
parameters.description: The GUID of a specific code scanning tool. Use this to filter alerts by the tool. Must not use with `tool_name`.

value_schema.description: The GUID of a code scanning tool. Only results by this tool will be listed. Note that some code scanning tools may not include a GUID in their analysis data. You can specify the tool by using either `tool_guid` or `tool_name`, but not both.

parameters.name: cursor_before
parameters.description: A cursor used to fetch results occurring before this point in the data timeline.

value_schema.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header). If specified, the query only searches for results before this cursor.

parameters.name: results_after_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor indicating the point after which to retrieve results. Used for pagination.

value_schema.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header). If specified, the query only searches for results after this cursor.

parameters.name: results_page_number
parameters.description: The page number of the results to fetch from the list of code scanning alerts.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page, with a maximum limit of 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order of the results. Use 'asc' for ascending or 'desc' for descending.

value_schema.description: The direction to sort the results by.

parameters.name: alert_state
parameters.description: Filter code scanning alerts by their state: 'open', 'closed', 'dismissed', or 'fixed'.

value_schema.description: If specified, only code scanning alerts with this state will be returned.

parameters.name: sort_results_by
parameters.description: Specifies the property by which to sort the results. Options are 'created' or 'updated'.

value_schema.description: The property by which to sort the results.

parameters.name: alert_severity
parameters.description: Specifies the severity of code scanning alerts to be returned. Acceptable values include 'critical', 'high', 'medium', 'low', 'warning', 'note', and 'error'.

value_schema.description: If specified, only code scanning alerts with this severity will be returned.
